stone.io

Class InputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • stone.io.InputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class InputStream
extends java.io.InputStream
    A class for a BufferedInputStream reading from a file
    Author:
    Nelphindal

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputStream()
      Generates an empty InputStream
      InputStream(java.io.File file, java.nio.charset.Charset cs)
      Generates a new InputStream reading from given file

      • getMarkedLoc

        public final int getMarkedLoc()
                       throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Returns relative offset from current position in this stream to a previously marked location.
        Returns:
        relative offset from current position in this stream to marked location, -1 if there is no more mark
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more marked position is available
        See Also:
        readTo(byte, byte)

      • read

        public final int read()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Returns next byte in this stream.
        Specified by:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Returns:
        next byte in this stream or -1 if there is no more byte because end of file has been reached. Further reading will throw an appropriate IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading in the file

      • read

        public final int read(byte[] buffer)

        Tries to read as many bytes as needed to fill given buffer
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Parameters:
        buffer - buffer to fill
        Returns:
        number of bytes read, -1 on EOF
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading in the file

      • read

        public final int read(byte[] buffer,
                      int offset,
                      int length)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to read as many bytes as needed to fill given buffer.
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Parameters:
        buffer - buffer to fill
        offset - position in the buffer to start
        length - number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        number of bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading in the file
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if offset or length do not fulfill the requirements

      • readFully

        public final byte[] readFully()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all remaining bytes and returns them in a byte array.
        Returns:
        byte array holding bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the file

      • readLine

        public final java.lang.String readLine()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes until next byte indicating new line (i.e. 0x0a) is reached. The byte 0x0a is removed as well as Windows line (0x0d 0x0a)
        Returns:
        bytes between current position and a 0x0a byte
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the file

      • readTo

        public final byte[] readTo(byte terminal)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes until next byte matching given terminal is reached.
        Parameters:
        terminal - byte to stop reading at
        Returns:
        bytes between current position and given terminal byte
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the file

      • readTo

        public final byte[] readTo(byte terminal,
                           byte mark)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes until next byte matching given terminal is reached. All positions of bytes matching given byte mark are marked
        Parameters:
        terminal - byte to stop reading at
        mark - byte to mark the position
        Returns:
        bytes between current position and given terminal byte
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the file
        See Also:
        getMarkedLoc()
